mentionedBy.name: CyberArk Software
mentionedBy.notes: Delivers unified identity, device, and access management platform making it easy to securely manage identities, devices, and access across organization. IT teams and MSPs enable users to work securely from anywhere and manage Windows, Apple, Linux, and Android devices from single platform.

mentionedBy.name: Jamf Holding Corp.
mentionedBy.notes: Cross-platform MDM and identity management platform, unified directory service

mentionedBy.name: Jamf Holding Corp.
mentionedBy.notes: Cross-platform directory and MDM solution that competes with Jamf for organizations managing mixed device environments requiring unified identity and access management.

mentionedBy.name: Okta Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Comprehensive cloud-based directory platform that centralizes identity, access, and device management

mentionedBy.name: Okta Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Cloud-native solution offering extensive device authentication and configuration policies. Starts at $13 per user per month with annual billing. Limited SSO capabilities and requires complex configurations but strong in device management.

2024.note: Cross-platform MDM and identity management platform, unified directory service
Comprehensive cloud-based directory platform that centralizes identity, access, and device management

2025.note: Delivers unified identity, device, and access management platform making it easy to securely manage identities, devices, and access across organization. IT teams and MSPs enable users to work securely from anywhere and manage Windows, Apple, Linux, and Android devices from single platform.
Cross-platform directory and MDM solution that competes with Jamf for organizations managing mixed device environments requiring unified identity and access management.

Cloud-native solution offering extensive device authentication and configuration policies. Starts at $13 per user per month with annual billing. Limited SSO capabilities and requires complex configurations but strong in device management.
